Key Match Events: Luka Doncic nearly finished the game with a triple-double with 32 points, 9 rebounds, and 7 assists.
Daniel Gafford was unstoppable inside the paint throughout the game with 18 points and 8 rebounds.
Kyrie Irving scored 17 points, and Dereck Lively II had 11 points and 11 rebounds.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mavericks came from an upsetting loss against the Houston Rockets and hoped to get back in the win column against the Magic.
Post-Match Reflections: The Mavericks dominated the Orlando Magic on Sunday after coming up with a 108-85 victory.
Dallas will take on the Indiana Pacers next and will hope to take advantage of their momentum.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Luka Doncic put up a solid first-quarter performance with 14 points, five rebounds, and three assists.
The Mavericks ended the first half with a huge 65-40 lead thanks to Luka Doncic's unstoppable offense.
Others: Klay Thompson finished the game with nine points, five rebounds, four assists, and two blocks, despite struggling with inefficient shooting splits.
